pullRequest.body:
This will be used to prove the existence of symmetric chain decompositions.

From LeanCamCombi

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

nodes.body:
### PR summary [9953d8e637](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20062/commits/9953d8e637bbb9a21759f01a63464ddd1d25c934)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Data.Finset.Powerset | 480 | 481 | +1 (+0.21%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 3298 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 143265 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Set.pairwiseDisjoint_iff`
`+ Set.pairwiseDisjoint_pair_insert`
`+ insert_diff_self_of_mem`
`+ insert_erase_invOn`
`+ not_mem_subset`
`+ pairwiseDisjoint_iff`
`+ pairwiseDisjoint_pair_insert`
`+ ⟨_,`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Oh! I thought this was in a finset file
surely this is an anti lemma
We have `Finset.not_mem_subset` and `Set.not_mem_mono`. What do you suggest the name of those two become?
I'd say they should both be `not_mem_subset`

Hmm, is there a nice way of using this to get
```
    (s.powerset : Set (Finset α)).PairwiseDisjoint fun t ↦ ({t, insert a t} : Finset (Finset α)) := by
```
too?
I always forget when we can just `Sort*`, but isn't indexing types one of the cases?

pullRequest.title: feat: the pairs  `{t, insert a t}` are pairwise disjoint
